newsitem.title: CANADA: Canada August housing starts little changed.
newsitem.headline: Canada August housing starts little changed.

text.p: Canadian housing starts were little changed in August at a seasonally adjusted annual rate (SAAR) of 128,500 units, from a revised 128,400 units in July, the Canada Mortgage and Housing Corp (CMHC) said on Tuesday.
A Reuter survey of economists had forecast housing starts of 134,700 units.
Actual housing starts fell to 9,537 in August from a revised 13,429 the month before. The SAAR is a monthly figure adjusted to remove normal seasonal variation and multiplied by 12.
CMHC provided the following SAAR data for urban centers:
The housing corporation said recent declines in mortgage rates usually boost the existing home market first.

"The rate reductions will have more of an effect on housing starts over the next few months, especially if mortgage rates remain low," said Michel Laurence, senior economist with the CMHC market analysis center.
